reviewText: Strong marketing has been directed to 5 years old and older children. The movies are acceptable for most children eight and older. The story lines although mature, they are not over the top. The violence is apart of any super hero movies, yet not too graffic. My now 9 year old son will enjoy watching the movies many times over.
We purchased this for our kids as a Christmas gift.  They are superhero junkies.  It is an excellent value for the 2 movies.  I recommend it to everyone.

Short resumed Director Tim Story has done an excellent job with the film adaptation of the Marvel super-hero gang The Fantastic 4. He brought on a terrific cast, used some great special effects and made a couple of movies that the whole family can enjoy together. The criticism for the Fantastic 4 series seems to center around two similar objections. 1) Fans of the comic books are dissatisfied with the less intense film adaptations. And 2) The series is too light and family oriented. Indeed, those are valid objections if you've come looking for Marvel adaptations like The Blade Trilogy,Daredevil or The Punisher. Even the Spider-Man and the X-Men trilogies far exceed Fantastic 4 in adult-oriented content. The Fantastic 4 series holds up quite well as a family franchise. The stories are very well put together. There are funny moments and there's great action. The acting cast is good and they take their roles seriously. Sure, the movies get campy at times. But, c'mon...it's a 1960s comic book adaptation. But the modern twists and especially the modern special effects make these films thoroughly entertaining for young and old. Fun movies, and the sequel is even better than the original.
Both of these movies were excellent. Awesome special effects. The actors did an excellent job of portraying their screen personalities.

Fantastic Four and Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer are two great films, I love the second one and the first one has some funny moments. Defintely one to get if you love the comic book. Great holiday gift purchase. Enjoy!

I really liked this movie, you have to go into this movie not expecting a classic & you will be very pleased, the effects were great, I was not happy with the Galactis cloud, like everyone else, but the rest was very good.

I decided to get this 2-movie set version for the value and convenience.  The original Fantastic Four movie disc offers the movie in Widescreen with a couple of featurettes.  The Silver Surfer movie disc shows the movie in Full Screen format on side A and Widescreen on side B with commentary available.  While I didn't expect all the bells and whistles on the second film that was offered in the other released editions, it would have been nice to have one featurette included.
I enjoyed both movies as entertaining diversions.  The special effects are quite good.  The characters continue the first film's fun banter in the second film.  However, don't expect great depth into the characters.
I love multiple sets of stories on one DVD set.  This one has four of my favorites.  It arrive perfectly packed also.
The second disc would not play.  When you hit play it says the operation is restricted.

The Fantastic Four movies literally are FANTASTIC!!! A perfect cast. I loved it. They acted just like the comic book characters. Except for a little immodesty, (Susan Storm with nothing on but a bra and panties in the first film and nothing on at all (you don't see too much) in the second one. Also women wearing hardly anything at all at Reed's bachelor party. All Johnny's fault!!!) A couple rude things said by Johnny, but still two great films! Ioan Gruffudd played Reed Richards beautifully! Which I was so happy about because Reed is one of my favorites (if not). I couldn't have asked for a better actress for Susan Storm than Jessica Alba! She was awesome! She is the girl! She didn't keep up with any of those guys' crud. Michael Chiklis played very nice for Ben Grimm. I felt so sorry for him and I think they did a good job at showing what distress and what a problem he had living as the Thing. I began to like his character a lot better watching him in the films. He is such a cute and loving character (Alicia and Ben are so cute!) Chris Evans playing Johnny Storm was amazing! I know him and watch him all the time as Captain America so when I saw him play this character it completely threw me off! He was so different. He is a complete hot-head and really loves himself. But I was so happy at the end of the Silver Surfer when he gave himself up and and realized it wasn't about him. I loved the part when he took all the Fantastic Four powers! He looked amazing! I loved when Susan was getting married and he told her she looked beautiful. Even though he is this really "I can do this by myself and I don't need a silly older sister to throw me around", he really, truly loves Susan and you saw that especially in the second one.
Doctor Doom was sooooo well done! I was very impressed. The dude's scary! I thought bringing the whole thing of him and Susan being a thing really was interesting and a good thing to throw in. (don't worry! It didn't last! Thank goodness!) The Silver Surfer was very well done too. In the comics I find him as a sort of a Spock character and he even acted like Spock in this film.
Anyway, I thought these movies were really, really, good. Met ALL of my expectations! I am a HUGE Fantastic Four fan and these films were perfect! I didn't watch Electra and Daredevil because of the R rating and Electra seems a little strange. But I definitely say if you want to know who and about the Fantastic Four, these movies are the go to!

I made the mistake of believing a review / "correction" (then at the top of the lists) which stated that there were extensive Special Features in this product -- contrary to prior correct assertions by others (e.g. "Silver Phoenix") who said there were almost none.  I soon found that the "correction" (by "Brian T") that I'd relied on was simply Flat-Out Wrong!
Upon receiving the factory-sealed product, I loaded it up and found that there were absolutely ZERO (0) special features on Disk#2 ("... Rise of the Silver..."):  There was ONE and Only One choice on the initial / Disk Menu screen -- "Play [the movie]".
Disk#1 ("Fantastic Four") contains ONE and Only One (1) commentary track by 3 of the F4 actors. Chris Evans wasn't included, though the others made several very positive remarks about his great contribution -- including the revelation that he ad-lib'ed much of his own dialogue and, in so doing, greatly improved both the pacing and overall interest of the movie (their observation).
The only other "extras" in the set (all on Disk 1) were several short previews (really just "internet" ads) for other DVD products.
The "correction" that I'd relied on was Flat-Out Wrong!
I may be a bit unusual in that a big reason that I buy physical DVDs & Blu-Rays (rather than simply rely on a download service) is to get these extras.  I am, therefore, quite disappointed.
So I am now faced with trying to find a source for these "extras" and buying them in addition to what I've already purchased. While I haven't worked out an actual net dollar amount that this misleading review cost me, with shipping costs it cannot be totally inconsequential...  At least the movies were good. (5 stars for them, 0 for Spec. Features;  Avg = 2.5; I should have given it 2 stars, but the package wasn't that worthless.))

Purchased the "own the moments" blu-ray two pack, some notes:

-Rise of Silver Surfer Disc was defective, will not play on either updated/web connected blu-ray player in my home.  I do not know if the two pack would have a higher defective rate than singles.  Actually i do not beleive i have ever had a blu-ray DOA.  Amazon returns are easy, just have to remember to get this in the mail.

-Packaging: The cover is just as pictured.  The "own the moments" label and white fields give this a cheasy discount rack look that could have been avoided.  It is a single blu-ray case that holds both movies.  If you are wondering why i'd be surprised that it looks just as it is pictured, it's because i also purchased the "Punisher" two-pack which contained the original two movies in original cases wrapped together with a disposable "two pack" insert placed on top.  This (FF) saves space, but looks cheasy.

-Movies themselves:  a quick note or two, as I assume most know what they are getting.  These are probably some of the worst major studio comic book movie adaptations in the last decade.  That also says a lot about the quality of most comic book movies recently, as they are not unwatchable in themselves.  On a positive note, they really are family friendly compared to the recent crop of excellent, but edgier, movies.  These movies are not "Marvel Studios" quality, but i think they are better than Daredevil and the first Punisher.  Some of us just have to have all of these super hero movies...

I'm giving this a two star recommendation to others.  I'd say the movies themselves might rate three.  This particular package/presentation gets two.  Obviously mine was defective (less than a star), but lets assume that is unusual unless other reviewers have the same experience.  I count on Amazon to make it right with me as they aften do; if you are curious i'm personally taking the refund rather than replacement.
Though the Fantastic Four is not the best marvel movie at this price it's still great.  The interpretation of Galactus is strange.  They definately took liberties with the Fantastic Four storyline.

I won't argue about comic-to-film translation. Expecting things to be exact from the comic book should be ideals left at the door. This is F4 the movie, you can read the comic book at your local comic store (I encourage you to do so!). F4 is a great movie if you can expect to have a good time with a comic book film, one that doesn't take itself too serious like the Dark Knight trilogy, nor overly comedic, like The Incredibles, but somewhere between. And I think that's the tone a Fantastic 4 film should take. While I enjoyed the first movie, I have to be honest, in the theater I was somewhat disappointed with its sequel. But over time I can sit down and enjoy it for what it is. I think time does that for some movies. Its OK to change and grow your opinions!

The transfer to blu-ray disc is pleasing and fairly standard as far as transfer go, being just as vibrant as it was in the theater. These are mostly bright films, even when its dark outside. Surround sound is also pleasing enough, using a very sci-fi pallet of sounds. Extra's are on the poor side, ripping them (and the disc design) from the DVD's essentially, and I would say that brings the overall rating down to 3 stars but the fact this edition has both films I bumped it up to 4 (when I purchased the "Own the Moments" edition it was a steal being a few bucks over the price of just one film).

Great movies if you can just stop being so critical, grab a big bowl of popcorn and your favorite soda, and have fun. I mean, this is fun for the whole family without alienating adults in my opinion. And since the Fantastic Four is one crazy family (maybe more than some families), its a win-win.

I got this two-pack for really cheap.  My kids have since watched the movies over and over.  The first movie is pretty silly and thin.  The second movie is better, but still not as good as many of the other comic-movies (Dark Knight, X-Men, Spider Man 1 and 2).  The kids don't mind though... they already got my money's worth out of it in the first few weeks.

Amazon's aspect ratio info is incorrect. These movies are not 1:85:1 (filling widescreen entirely) but rather the theatrical widescreen aspect (black bars top and bottom). Disappointing, but not a deal-breaker. The stories are not as compeling and the characters not as developed as other superhero movies (e.g. Spiderman and Ironman) but they are still a lot of fun, especially for longtime FF fans. And the blu-ray is stunning!

Fantastic Four / Fantastic Four: Rise of Silver [Blu-ray] I bought this off of Amazon thinking it included both movies as well as special features, but the description on here was extremely vague. This bluray set has NO special features at all, and the aspect ratio listed on Amazon is incorrect. The actual aspect ratio for each movie is: Fantastic Four (Widescreen 2:35:1) and Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer (Widescreen 2:40:1). I was disappointed that I have to return this as I just received it today, but if I'm buying it on bluray I want all the features. If you're only interested in the movies then this would be great for you, but otherwise it's an unnecessary bundle when they've already had different bundles already put together. This would have been perfect if it contained everything. Edit: Apparently someone who purchased this set (Brian T) has posted that there are indeed special features included in this set of the Fantastic Four films. The first film contains 2 commentaries and a trailer while the second apparently has a lot of special features. I returned this item initially because of no information given on the package sleeve about special features and many people will find themselves in a similar situation because of it. I still rate the movies as 3 stars for an average as they're good but not "Fantastic" yet the bigger issue is with Fox and their poor product manufacturing when it comes to information given on products. The movies themselves are worth seeing even without the special features but you want as much content as possible for your purchase. Even Amazon doesn't list that there are any special features and that is completely the fault of this "Own the Moments" series.
I sure enjoyed this product with my sons .we are fans of the comics and liked this very much. We will be purchacing more from this vendor

I really hoped this movie would resemble the X-Men Trilogy (X-Men/ X2 - X-Men United/ X-Men - The Last Stand), which I thought was a model of how to transform a comic book into a movie. Unfortunately, Fantastic Four falls a bit flat. That casting is part of the problem. I thought Chris Evans was funny as Johnny "Torch." However, Jessica Alba as a scientist? I'm sorry, that's just casting so against type that it doesn't work. There's also no plot or emotional depth. The film tries to add some morality with Ben Grimm (Michael Chiklis), but it just seems superficial (an the silly orange costume doesn't help). The real problem is Julian McMahon as Victor Van Doom. I've always said a good movie needs a compelling villain. Van Doom's just a horrible, superficial villain. His only motive appears to be the lust for more power - so boring and cliche. He also has some of the corniest lines in the movie. For example, during the middle of the climatic fight scene, when zapping Jessica Alba with lightning, he says "Susan, you're fired!" That really breaks the mood and tension of the scene. It's probably worth watching Fantastic Four once if you like action movies, but this isn't a keeper. Overall, Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer is better than its predecessor. The acting, effects, and plot are all a step up. The movie also has more memorable and emotionally poignant scenes (such as when Ben and Johnny sit in a bar discussing how they would spend their last minutes, Ben scaring the bear away...). I'm still not crazy as Julian McMahon as Van Doom - and he still says corny lines in the middle of battles - but he's not so central to this movie. On the other hand, the Silver Surfer makes for a much better villain - mysterious, cool, and powerful. I like the end - a bit of The Day the Earth Stood Still (Two-Disc Widescreen Edition). I still don't think it's quite as good as the X-Men Trilogy, but Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer is at least not quite as careless an effort. Just a note for concerned audiences: there are a few sexual innuendoes in the movies. They'll fly right over the head of most kids, but might be worth mentioning.
